commit_message:
Allow local scaphandre directory to be mapped to an instance using virtiofs

Simplify usage of scaphandre agent. Allowing users to reports VM
consumption and VM processes consumption.

Implements: blueprint virtiofs-scaphandre

Change-Id: Ic27781ca5c5e1dc4020524592d0ff9e712ae0c6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/81/861881/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================================================= Allow local scaphandre directory to be mapped to an instance using virtiofs ============================================================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/tbd Scaphandre is a tool that can be used to mesure compute and VM power consumption down to processes. (https://github.com/hubblo-org/scaphandre) This was used by the BBC to create environmental dashboards: https://superuser.openstack.org/articles/environmental-reporting-dashboards-for-openstack-from-bbc-rd/ Problem description =================== Currently, this is not possible to get consumption per VM as scaphandre requires a directory on the compute node accessible into running VMs. This directory contains data required by the scaphandre instance (guest agent) running on the VM to correctly reports VM and VM associated processes consumption. Scaphandre proposed solution to get these data is to mount the directory using virtiofs in the VM. However, the user can not do that, as it requires a VM XML definition file to be modified, and this is managed can only be done by nova. Use Cases --------- - As a user, I want to know the consumption of my compute node and drill down to VM and VM processes individual consumption. - As an administrator, I want to allow this usage but make sure the user can mount only the configured required directory. down to VM and VM processes individual consumption. Proposed change =============== This change relies on https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/yoga/approved/libvirt-virtiofs-attach-manila-shares.html specification. Proposed solution requires to slightly modify the shares API and compute configuration: - Add an allow list maintained by administrator to define the scaphandre directory as a filesystem that is allowed to be mounted in the VM. - Change the shares rest API to allow user to pass the scaphandre directory location that needs to be mounted from the compute to the VM. - If a directory is passed, skip the mount / umount part from manilla in that case. Alternatives ------------ TBD REST API impact --------------- * ``POST /servers/{server_id}/shares`` Attach a share to an instance. Add a mutually exclusive ``export_location`` field to ``shareId`` that will allow for mounting that directory as a "local" share on the VM. Return Code(s): 202,400,401,403,404,409 .. note:: In that case shareId will be reported as local. Request body: .. code-block:: json { "share": { "export_location": "/var/scaphandre" } } Response body: .. code-block:: json { "share": { "shareId": "local", "status": "inactive", "tag": "e8debdc0-447a-4376-a10a-4cd9122d7986" } } PROJECT_ADMIN will be able to see details of the attachment id and export location stored within Nova: .. code-block:: json { "share": { "attachmentId": "715335c1-7a00-4dfe-82df-9dc2a67bd8bf", "shareId": "local", "status": "inactive", "tag": "e8debdc0-447a-4376-a10a-4cd9122d7986", "export_location": "/var/scaphandre" } } Data model impact ----------------- NA Security impact --------------- Administrator can restrict what can be mounted to the VM with the share_local_directory_list allow list parameters. Notifications impact -------------------- NA Other end user impact --------------------- The installation and configuration of scaphandre is left to the openstack administrator. Performance Impact ------------------ NA Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- NA Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: uggla (rene.ribaud) Feature Liaison --------------- Feature liaison: uggla Work Items ---------- - Add new shares API and microversion Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= - Functional libvirt driver and API tests - Integration Tempest tests Documentation Impact ==================== Extensive admin and user documentation will be provided. References ========== History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Antelope - Introduced

commit_message:
ovn: add ovn-monitor-all variable

Setting ovn-monitor-all to 'true' will configure
ovn-controller to monitor all OVS database records
unconditionally. That will release some CPU resource
from OVS Southbound DB but will increase number of events
coming to ovn-controller.

Default value is 'false'.

Change-Id: I291e166013d8c88f00e84ceaf308251c352c9a79
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/26/868326/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Adds ``ovn-monitor-all`` variable. A boolean value that tells if ovn-controller should unconditionally monitor all records in OVS databases. Setting ``ovn-monitor-all`` variable to 'true' will remove some CPU load from OVN SouthBound DB but will effect with more updates comming to ovn-controller. Might be helpfull in large deployments with many compute hosts.

subject: Fix CreateVIPBasePort revert function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-12-20 13:46:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/5bde752e998747fb2fb69d550ad0727403ba8b52', 'message': 'Fix CreateVIPBasePort review function

CreateVIPBasePort.execute returns a port (an object in v1, a dict in
v2), but the revert function expected a list of ports (objects in both
v1 and v2).

So during a revert of a flow, this log might have appeared in the logs:
  "Failed to delete port <octavia.network.data_models.Port object at
  0xxxxxxxxxxxxx>. Resources may still be in use for a port intended for

commit_message:
Fix CreateVIPBasePort revert function

CreateVIPBasePort.execute returns a port (an object in v1, a dict in
v2), but the revert function expected a list of ports (objects in both
v1 and v2).

So during a revert of a flow, this log might have appeared in the logs:
  "Failed to delete port <octavia.network.data_models.Port object at
  0xxxxxxxxxxxxx>. Resources may still be in use for a port intended for
  amphora xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx due to error 'Port'
  object is not iterable. Search for a port named
  octavia-lb-vrrp-xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"

This commit fixes this code, the revert of the Task is now handled
properly.

Change-Id: I98286a6f65c3757e224d84e2942d0d0555e8e877
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/15/868215/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

When comparing variables, should use assertEqual

Closed-Bug: #2002460

commit_message:
Retry on iDRAC SYS518 errors for all requests

When iDRAC is still loading, some of the components is not available
for short period of time and returns HTTP 500 error with SYS518 error
code and message "iDRAC is currently unable to display any information
because data sources are unavailable.". There is already retry on GET
errors with Server side error, but this can happen also for other
requests, for example, DELETE.
This patch adds retry for all SYS518 failures disregarding request
method. This helps to fix a known intermittent issue when deleting
set of volumes one after another and iDRAC is reloading after
deleting each volume.

Co-Authored-By: Swapnil Machikar <swapnil.machikar@yahoo.com>
Change-Id: Ief49157438813c650fdd34d60dfe7ea8ea2d1702
(cherry picked from commit 2b760a6c9ef23ca2a9f736ca6a6c8c146490f1c3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sushy refs/changes/79/868779/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('time.sleep', autospec=True) def test_op_retry_on_server_500_sys518(self, mock_sleep): response_info = {"error": {"@Message.ExtendedInfo": [ {'MessageId': 'IDRAC.2.7.SYS518'}]}} mock_error = mock.Mock() mock_error.status_code = 500 mock_error.json.return_value = response_info self.request.return_value.status_code = ( http_client.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR) self.request.return_value.json.side_effect =\ exceptions.ServerSideError( method='DELETE', url='http://foo.bar', response=mock_error) self.assertRaises(exceptions.ServerSideError, self.conn._op, 'DELETE', 'http://foo.bar') self.assertEqual(10, mock_sleep.call_count) self.assertEqual(11, self.request.call_count) @mock.patch('time.sleep', autospec=True) def test_op_retry_on_server_500_other_than_sys518(self, mock_sleep): response_info = {"error": {"@Message.ExtendedInfo": [ {'MessageId': 'IDRAC.2.7.SYS999'}]}} mock_error = mock.Mock() mock_error.status_code = 500 mock_error.json.return_value = response_info self.request.return_value.status_code = ( http_client.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR) self.request.return_value.json.side_effect =\ exceptions.ServerSideError( method='DELETE', url='http://foo.bar', response=mock_error) self.assertRaises(exceptions.ServerSideError, self.conn._op, 'DELETE', 'http://foo.bar') self.assertEqual(0, mock_sleep.call_count) self.assertEqual(1, self.request.call_count)

commit_message:
Add stable/zed jobs on master gate

As zed is released, we should add its job on master
gate to keep branchless tempest plugins compatible
to stable branch.

Ref: Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

Change-Id: I10bbcdf711ede18496545e6a4b1fd1098388e891

commit_message:
Set nohz_full in cpu-pinning element

nohz_full (or full dynticks) is a Linux kernel setting that should reduce
kernel noise on configured CPUs to a minimum. This change activates this
setting on all vCPUs except the first one.

Change-Id: Ie009aff52d572873da0bb5cc43fedd7f3325dccc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/02/853802/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | The cpu-pinning element for the amphora image sets the kernel bootarg nohz_full=1-N to enable full dynticks on all CPUs except the first one (on single CPU images this will have no effect). This should reduce kernel noise on those CPUs to a minimum and reduce latency. upgrade: - | In order for the full dynticks feature to become effective the amphora image (of new load balancers and of existing load balancers) needs to be updated. Users with custom flavors with more than a single vCPU will get a different behavior after updating (see feature description).

commit_message:
Fix invalid job dependency

The latest python3 job template does not contain python 3.9 job but
only 3.8 and 3.10 jobs. This updates the dependency to avoid the error.

Change-Id: I733856564c552843df3e02045ead634e7e8bfb0d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/98/869798/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Release octavia-tempest-plugin 2.2.0

This is the Antelope MS2 release for octavia-tempest-plugin

530a88a Make user role logging optional
5779531 tox skipsdist seems to be problematic
4a61eeb Add scenario test for Prometheus over TLS
8646e5a API and scenario tests for PROMETHEUS listeners.
295576d Pin barbican-tempest-plugin to version 1.6.0
5aa216e Remove skip flag for tests skipped due to inactive bug

Changes to external roles cause some variables to be passed in

commit_message:
Handle omitted variables which appear as empty strings

Changes to external roles cause some variables to be passed in
as empty strings which result in invalid config and InvalidArgument
errors.

This could be addressed here or in the calling role.

Change-Id: Iee71e9839d4c8d318c2c36152d966dd5a1b88111
(cherry picked from commit 4a7012e366ba60b99ec022eafbfe23afc9f6247a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_networkd refs/changes/39/869839/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if _addr.gateway is defined and (_addr.gateway | length) > 0 %}{% if item.1.mtu is defined and item.1.mtu %}
deleted_lines: {% if _addr.gateway is defined %}{% if item.1.mtu is defined %}

subject: Fix static routes to use Destination rather than Source key
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-01-11 22:15:17.000000000', 'files': ['templates/systemd-network.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_networkd/commit/f476606bb2db1f0325fd6276e9236ae965ee9719', 'message': 'Fix static routes to use Destination rather than Source key

The current template results in a default route being added to the
routing table rather than a route specific to the destination
requested.

Change-Id: I0ef53631989ea2dc12d2540edeed95d0a466353b
(cherry picked from commit 5acf51aec34005ef756b917c77874e5f14fa7ae3)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix static routes to use Destination rather than Source key

The current template results in a default route being added to the
routing table rather than a route specific to the destination
requested.

Change-Id: I0ef53631989ea2dc12d2540edeed95d0a466353b
(cherry picked from commit 5acf51aec34005ef756b917c77874e5f14fa7ae3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_networkd refs/changes/35/869835/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Destination={{ route['cidr'] }}
deleted_lines: Source={{ route['cidr'] }}

'}, {'number': 15, 'created': '2022-08-19 09:44:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/a6bd897fd35b5af9cf6dfca6615106a5bffe5c2c', 'message': 'Add cpu-pinning element

The new "cpu-pinning" element optimizes the amphora image for better
vertical scaling. When an amphora flavor with multiple vCPUs is
configured it will configure the kernel to isolate (isolcpus)
all vCPUs except the first one.
Furthermore, it uninstalls irqbalance and sets the IRQ affinity to the
first CPU. That way the other CPUs are free to be used by HAProxy
exclusively. A new customized TuneD profile applies some more tweaks
for improving network latency.

Change-Id: I1a0591de79be867483a044705e866b2368b2a567

commit_message:
Add cpu-pinning element

The new "cpu-pinning" element optimizes the amphora image for better
vertical scaling. When an amphora flavor with multiple vCPUs is
configured it will configure the kernel to isolate (isolcpus)
all vCPUs except the first one.
Furthermore, it uninstalls irqbalance and sets the IRQ affinity to the
first CPU. That way the other CPUs are free to be used by HAProxy
exclusively. A new customized TuneD profile applies some more tweaks
for improving network latency.

This new feature is disabled by default in diskimage-create.sh.

Story: 2010236
Task: 46042
Change-Id: I1a0591de79be867483a044705e866b2368b2a567
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/29/849129/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # tuned configuration # # Copyright Red Hat # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # [main] summary=Customized profile for use with Octavia amphorae include=network-latency # TODO network-throughput? # Reserve all CPUs except the first one for HAProxy [variables] isolated_cores=1-63 no_balance_cores=1-63 # tmpdir tmpdir=${f:strip:${f:exec:mktemp:-d}} # Non-isolated cores cpumask including offline cores isolated_cores_expanded=${f:cpulist_unpack:${isolated_cores}} isolated_cpumask=${f:cpulist2hex:${isolated_cores_expanded}} not_isolated_cores_expanded=${f:cpulist_invert:${isolated_cores_expanded}} isolated_cores_online_expanded=${f:cpulist_online:${isolated_cores}} not_isolated_cores_online_expanded=${f:cpulist_online:${not_isolated_cores_expanded}} not_isolated_cpumask=${f:cpulist2hex:${not_isolated_cores_expanded}} # Make sure no_balance_cores is defined before # no_balance_cores_expanded is defined, so that child profiles can set # no_balance_cores directly in the profile (tuned.conf) no_balance_cores=${no_balance_cores} no_balance_cores_expanded=${f:cpulist_unpack:${no_balance_cores}} # Fail if isolated_cores contains CPUs which are not online assert2=${f:assertion:isolated_cores contains online CPU(s):${isolated_cores_expanded}:${isolated_cores_online_expanded}} cmd_isolcpus=${f:regex_search_ternary:${no_balance_cores}:\s*[0-9]: isolcpus=${no_balance_cores}:} [sysctl] kernel.hung_task_timeout_secs = 600 kernel.nmi_watchdog = 0 vm.stat_interval = 10 kernel.timer_migration = 0 [sysfs] /sys/bus/workqueue/devices/writeback/cpumask = ${not_isolated_cpumask} /sys/devices/virtual/workqueue/cpumask = ${not_isolated_cpumask} /sys/devices/virtual/workqueue/*/cpumask = ${not_isolated_cpumask} /sys/devices/system/machinecheck/machinecheck*/ignore_ce = 1 [systemd] cpu_affinity=${not_isolated_cores_expanded} [sysctl] type=sysctl kernel.numa_balancing=0 vm.stat_interval = 10 # See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1797629 kernel.timer_migration = 0 #[irqbalance] #banned_cpus=${isolated_cores} [script] script=${i:PROFILE_DIR}/script.sh [scheduler] isolated_cores=${isolated_cores} ps_blacklist=.*pmd.*;.*PMD.*;^DPDK;.*qemu-kvm.*;^contrail-vroute$;^lcore-slave-.*;^rte_mp_handle$;^rte_mp_async$;^eal-intr-thread$ [bootloader] cmdline=isolcpus=${isolated_cores}

commit_message:
Use extend volume completion action

This spec proposes to use the os-extend_volume_completion volume action
that has been proposed for Cinder to provide feedback on success or
failure when handling volume-extended external server events.

A previous version of this spec proposed a new API in Nova, but is has
since been rewritten completely.
The old version can be found in Patchset 6 and earlier.

Blueprint: assisted-volume-extend
Change-Id: I1a59cd571dfcec814df09e208979a481d4ea43af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/90/855490/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================== Add API for assisted volume extend ================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/assisted-volume-extend This blueprint proposes a new top-level API for extending attached volumes. This is necessary to allow Cinder to resize attached file-based volumes (such as the ones managed by the NFS driver), which has to be done by the QEMU process holding the lock on the file. Problem description =================== File-based volume drivers in Cinder use the ``qemu-img`` tool to extend volumes. However, when the volume is attached to a guest, QEMU will lock the file and ``qemu-img`` will be unable to resize it. In this case, only the QEMU process holding the lock can resize the volume, which can be triggered through the monitor. Libvirt supports this with the ``virsh blockresize`` command. The Nova API already has support for this mechanism through the ``volume-extended`` external server event. Unfortunately, this is not suitable for resizing attached volumes because the external server event API does not provide any feedback on whether an event was handled successfully. The instance action API does provide some feedback with ``extend_volume`` action entries, but does not provide any information on which volume a specific entry refers to. Also, the handler of the ``volume-extended`` event assumes that the size of the volume has already been updated in the database. If we rely on Nova to perform the actual resize, Cinder should not update the size (or commit the quota reservation) until it knows that the operation was successful. External server events, however, have only a single text field for arguments, which, in this case, is already used for the ID of the extended volume. So there is currently no clean way to communicate the new volume size to Nova, appart from updating it in the database. Extending attached volumes is currently disabled for the file-based NFS, NetApp ONTAP NFS, and Quobyte drivers. Previous discussion of the issue can be found in [1]_ and [2]_. Use Cases --------- As a user, I want to extend a NFS/NetApp ONTAP NFS/Quobyte volume while it is attached to an active instance. Proposed change =============== Introduce a new API microversion that adds the new ``POST /os-assisted-volume-extend`` API. The new API is intended to be used exclusively by Cinder when extending attached volumes, and it will require admin access to the Nova. Just like the ``volume-extended`` external server event, it will cause nova-compute to call the ``extend_volume`` method of the virt driver. Unlike the external server event, it will work synchronously, providing information on the success of the operation back to the caller, and the new volume size will be provided as an argument instead of being read from Cinder. Cinder will be updated to use the new API, if available. Alternatives ------------ One possible alternative would be to just ignore the lock and use a tool such as ``truncate`` to extend the volume file. This would allow Cinder to perform the resize, making any API changes unnecessary. Extending an in-use volume file should be safe as long as only the size is increased, however, it is hard to make any guarantees about this, and the QEMU documentation explicitely warns against externally modifying in-use disk image files [3]_. So the safer option is probably to have Nova perform the resize through Libvirt. In this case, Cinder needs to know whether the operation was successful or not. One option for this would be the introduction of a new callback in the Cinder API that could be used by the ``volume-extended`` handler to notify cinder of a success or failure to extend, somewhat similar to the ``os-migrate_volume_completion`` volume action in the Cinder API. However this would still be lacking a mechanism to communicate the new volume size to Nova, beyond changing it in Cinder's database, which we should avoid when the volume has not actually been extended yet. We might be able to abuse the volume metadata for this purpose, or even introduce a new field to the volume object. Both of these options have the problem of introducing additional state to the volume object, that we need to manage and clean up if anything goes wrong. A cleaner solution might be to extend the external server event API to take additional data per event, because this information is only required during the extend operation. We could also try to update the external event API to allow synchronous handling of events, so Cinder wouldn't need a separate callback. This would probably go beyond the scope of the external server event API, however, turning it into something like a second server action API. Modifying this API might also impact other services using it. Previous discussions of different alternatives can be found in [2]_ and the etherpad [4]_, which was created in the context of [1]_. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Starting with the new microversion, there will be a ``POST /os-assisted-volume-extend`` API, that can be called with a body of the following form:: { "volume-extend": { "server_id": "c90ba9ca-3026-46d9-a485-138538a6694f", "volume_id": "8ef7c423-e67e-454c-aaad-88da8b1a6b63", "new_size": 10 } } with ``volume_id`` being the UUID of the attached volume, ``server_id`` being the UUID of the server it is attached to, and ``new_size`` being the target size of the extend operation. * If successful, it will return HTTP 200 OK. * If the server or the volume does not exist, or if the volume is not attached to the server, or if the new size is smaller than the old size, it will return HTTP 400 Bad Request. * A version of nova-compute that does not support this feature yet should result in HTTP 500 Internal Server Error Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- If nova-compute does not yet support the new API (like during a rolling upgrade), the call will fail with ``500 Internal Server Error``. Cinder will catch this and roll back the extend operation. This is unlikely to happen in practice though, because it only affects volumes for which attached resize was previously unsupported. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: kgube Feature Liaison --------------- Feature liaison: None yet Work Items ---------- * extend the ``ComputeManager.extend_volume`` method with an optional new_size parameter to be used instead of the volumes current size. * make the method individually callable through the rpcapi. * create the new ``/os-assisted-volume-extend`` API to call the method. * adapt and extend the unit tests for the ``volume-extended`` event for the new API. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= The implementation builds on existing code (``ComputeManager.extend_volume``), so any tests for this code should be extended appropriately. Apart from this, we should test a successful call, as well as all the conditions leading to HTTP 400 and the case of nova-compute not yet supporting the feature. Documentation Impact ==================== Updating the API reference should be sufficient. References ========== .. [1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1870367 .. [2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1978294 .. [3] https://www.qemu.org/docs/master/tools/qemu-img.html .. [4] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/fix-nfs-online-extend History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Antelope - Introduced

commit_message:
EOL Metalsmith for stein

Metalsmith was missed when we EOL'd Ironic projects through stein,
because it wasn't introduced until stein. Fix this error.

Change-Id: Ibc2a40a692022ff1b3610167d1fc9c4d6d609017

subject: Improve agent provision performance for large networks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-10-13 00:57:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/6b65f33d99f328e7f050bdf4d010d1599052e2b6', 'message': 'Improve agent provision performance for large networks

Before this change, the metadata agent would provision network namespace
for all subnets under a network(datapath) as soon as the first VM(vif port)
was mounted on the chassis. This operation can take very long time for
networks with lots of subnets. See the linked bug for more details.
This change essentially changes this mechanism to "lazy load" where
metadata agent provisions the metadata namespace with only the subnets
belonging to the active ports on the chassis. This results in virtually constant
throughput not effected by the number of subnets.

Closes-Bug: #1981113

commit_message:
Improve agent provision performance for large networks

Before this patch, the metadata agent would provision network namespace
for all subnets under a network(datapath) as soon as the first
VM(vif port) was mounted on the chassis. This operation can take very
long time for networks with lots of subnets. See the linked bug for
more details.
This patch changes this mechanism to "lazy load" where metadata agent
provisions metadata namespace with only the subnets belonging to the
active ports on the chassis. This results in virtually constant
throughput not effected by the number of subnets.

Closes-Bug: #1981113
Change-Id: Ia2a66cfd3fd1380c5204109742d44f09160548d2

added_lines: class DatapathInfo: def __init__(self, uuid, external_ids): self.uuid = uuid self.external_ids = external_ids def __hash__(self): return hash(self.uuid) This test simulates that this chassis has four datapaths with mix of 'externa', ''(blank), 'unknown' port types. * datapath '1': 2 ports type '' and 1 port 'unknown' * datapath '2': 1 port type '' * datapath '3': 1 port with type 'external' * datapath '4': 1 port with type 'unknown' It is expected that only datapaths '1', '2' and '3' are provisioned once with the corresponding ports IP addresses datapath_1 = DatapathInfo(uuid='uuid1', external_ids={'name': 'neutron-1'}) datapath_2 = DatapathInfo(uuid='uuid2', external_ids={'name': 'neutron-2'}) datapath_3 = DatapathInfo(uuid='uuid3', external_ids={'name': 'neutron-3'}) datapath_4 = DatapathInfo(uuid='uuid4', external_ids={'name': 'neutron-4'}) ports = [ makePort(datapath_1, type='', mac=['fa:16:3e:e7:ac 1.2.3.4']), makePort(datapath_1, type='external', mac=['fa:16:3e:e7:ad 1.2.3.5']), makePort(datapath_1, type='unknown', mac=['fa:16:3e:e7:ae 1.2.3.6']), makePort(datapath_2, type='', mac=['fa:16:3e:e8:ac 1.2.4.4']), makePort(datapath_3, type='external', mac=['fa:16:3e:e9:ac 1.2.5.4']), makePort(datapath_4, type='unknown', mac=['fa:16:3f:e9:ac 1.3.6.4']) ] expected_calls = [ mock.call(datapath_1, ['1.2.3.4', '1.2.3.5']), mock.call(datapath_2, ['1.2.4.4']), mock.call(datapath_3, ['1.2.5.4']) ] self.assertEqual(expected_calls, sorted(pdp.call_args_list, key=lambda arg: arg.uuid)) def test__process_cidrs_when_current_namespace_empty(self): current_namespace_cidrs = set() datapath_port_ips = ['10.0.0.2', '10.0.0.3', '10.0.1.5'] metadaport_subnet_cidrs = ['10.0.0.0/30', '10.0.1.0/28', '11.0.1.2/24'] expected_cidrs_to_add = set(['10.0.0.0/30', '10.0.1.0/28', n_const.METADATA_CIDR]) expected_cidrs_to_delete = set() actual_result = self.agent._process_cidrs(current_namespace_cidrs, datapath_port_ips, metadaport_subnet_cidrs) actual_cidrs_to_add, actual_cidrs_to_delete = actual_result self.assertSetEqual(actual_cidrs_to_add, expected_cidrs_to_add) self.assertSetEqual(actual_cidrs_to_delete, expected_cidrs_to_delete) def test__process_cidrs_when_current_namespace_only_contains_metadata_cidr( self): current_namespace_cidrs = set([n_const.METADATA_CIDR]) datapath_port_ips = ['10.0.0.2', '10.0.0.3', '10.0.1.5'] metadaport_subnet_cidrs = ['10.0.0.0/30', '10.0.1.0/28', '11.0.1.2/24'] expected_cidrs_to_add = set(['10.0.0.0/30', '10.0.1.0/28']) expected_cidrs_to_delete = set() actual_result = self.agent._process_cidrs(current_namespace_cidrs, datapath_port_ips, metadaport_subnet_cidrs) actual_cidrs_to_add, actual_cidrs_to_delete = actual_result self.assertSetEqual(actual_cidrs_to_add, expected_cidrs_to_add) self.assertSetEqual(actual_cidrs_to_delete, expected_cidrs_to_delete) def test__process_cidrs_when_current_namespace_contains_stale_cidr(self): current_namespace_cidrs = set([n_const.METADATA_CIDR, '10.0.1.0/31']) datapath_port_ips = ['10.0.0.2', '10.0.0.3', '10.0.1.5'] metadaport_subnet_cidrs = ['10.0.0.0/30', '10.0.1.0/28', '11.0.1.2/24'] expected_cidrs_to_add = set(['10.0.0.0/30', '10.0.1.0/28']) expected_cidrs_to_delete = set(['10.0.1.0/31']) actual_result = self.agent._process_cidrs(current_namespace_cidrs, datapath_port_ips, metadaport_subnet_cidrs) actual_cidrs_to_add, actual_cidrs_to_delete = actual_result self.assertSetEqual(actual_cidrs_to_add, expected_cidrs_to_add) self.assertSetEqual(actual_cidrs_to_delete, expected_cidrs_to_delete) def test__process_cidrs_when_current_namespace_contains_mix_cidrs(self): """Current namespace cidrs contains stale cidrs and it is missing new required cidrs. """ current_namespace_cidrs = set([n_const.METADATA_CIDR, '10.0.1.0/31', '10.0.1.0/28']) datapath_port_ips = ['10.0.0.2', '10.0.1.5'] metadaport_subnet_cidrs = ['10.0.0.0/30', '10.0.1.0/28', '11.0.1.2/24'] expected_cidrs_to_add = set(['10.0.0.0/30']) expected_cidrs_to_delete = set(['10.0.1.0/31']) actual_result = self.agent._process_cidrs(current_namespace_cidrs, datapath_port_ips, metadaport_subnet_cidrs) actual_cidrs_to_add, actual_cidrs_to_delete = actual_result self.assertSetEqual(actual_cidrs_to_add, expected_cidrs_to_add) self.assertSetEqual(actual_cidrs_to_delete, expected_cidrs_to_delete) def test__preprovision_checks_returns_none_when_no_vif_ports(self): """Should return None when there are no datapath ports with type "external" or ""(blank) and call teardown datapath. """ network_id = '1' datapath = DatapathInfo(uuid='test123', external_ids={'name': 'neutron-{}'.format(network_id)}) datapath_ports = [makePort(datapath, type='not_vif_type')] with mock.patch.object(self.agent.sb_idl, 'get_ports_on_chassis', return_value=datapath_ports),\ mock.patch.object(self.agent, 'teardown_datapath') as tdp: tdp.assert_called_once_with(network_id) self.assertIsNone(self.agent._preprovision_checks(datapath)) def test__preprovision_checks_returns_none_when_metadata_port_is_missing( self): """Should return None when there is no metadata port in datapath and call teardown datapath. """ network_id = '1' datapath = DatapathInfo(uuid='test123', external_ids={'name': 'neutron-{}'.format(network_id)}) datapath_ports = [makePort(datapath, mac=['fa:16:3e:e7:ac 1.2.3.4'])] with mock.patch.object( self.agent.sb_idl, 'get_ports_on_chassis', return_value=datapath_ports),\ mock.patch.object( self.agent.sb_idl, 'get_metadata_port_network', return_value=None),\ mock.patch.object( self.agent, 'teardown_datapath') as tdp: tdp.assert_called_once_with(network_id) self.assertIsNone(self.agent._preprovision_checks(datapath)) def test__preprovision_checks_returns_none_when_metadata_port_missing_mac( self): """Should return None when metadata port is missing MAC and call teardown datapath. commit_message:
Cinder: Remove implementation for Dell SC driver

... because it was deprecated several cycles ago in favor of renaming
to Dell/EMC SC driver. The resource template to use this implementation
was already removed from t-h-t by [1].

[1] 3699a56891f8abce10d75a1b1cbbd6f2f775ff77

Change-Id: I4586a887ad25eaa2050ba1459842c248ecca478f

commit_message:
Review usage of oslo-privsep library on Nova

Nova's usage of the privsep library is too broad. A single global permission
profile with all needed capabilities is defined for all functions that interact
with privsep to use. While this works, it is not the best usage of the library
as functions are getting a set of rights they do not need and thus should not
receive. This spec seeks to fix this situation by defining a more specialized
usage of the library.

Change-Id: I713ddd60275f29f4361a4c6e93b7299f1d31aa85
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/32/865432/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Review usage of oslo-privsep library on Nova ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/privsep-usage-review Nova's usage of the privsep library is too broad. A single global permission profile with all needed capabilities is defined for all functions that interact with privsep to use. While this works, it is not the best usage of the library as functions are getting a set of rights they do not need and thus should not receive. This spec seeks to fix this situation by defining a more specialized usage of the library. Problem description =================== Nova compute services use the oslo-privsep library to obtain some root privileges on the host system with the intention of invoking commands on it. Thing is, current usage of the library by Nova does not follow good practices. A single permission profile is shared by all functions that make use of the library, and this one aggregates all capabilities required by the entirety of them. This means that because of a function that operates over files, another one that does nothing over them will get rights over the filesystem as their profile is shared. This may lead to unexpected behaviors on the system that can be avoided if just enough capabilities are used on each case. Use Cases --------- As a developer, I want to have a fined tuned method for acquiring root rights. As an admin, I want Nova to use root as little as possible. Proposed change =============== Considering that all functions that use the privsep library are found under ``nova.privsep``. First step is to study and map each with the capabilities they require. Next, a set of profiles can be defined for common use cases, such as network or system rights, and cover with them as much as possible. For the rest, a custom per case profile will need to be defined. If possible, profiles could be defined within each of the modules that use them, instead of in ``__init__.py`` like now, in order to reduce their scope. Alternatives ------------ None that I can think of. Please, provide any feedback on the scope of this spec and its approach. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- Requires the use of elevated privileges. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Incorrect mapping of elevated capabilities may result on failing system commands. Other deployer impact --------------------- The change has immediate effect once merged. Developer impact ---------------- Developers will need to analyze which capabilities are required for any new functions under ``nova.privsep`` and apply the correct profile accordingly. Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: jsanemet Feature Liaison --------------- Feature liaison: sylvainb Work Items ---------- * Study functions that already use oslo-privsep to determine which capabilities each need. * Define profiles for functions that share a common context, i.e.: run a system command, modify network settings... * Define by-case profiles for functions that were not covered by the general ones. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Tempest tests could be defined targeting functionality that interacts with the host system, testing through that the functions affected by this spec. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== First discussed at: https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/nova-privsep-review History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - 2023.1 Antelope - Introduced

commit_message:
Update OVN northd group documentation

Existing docs are missing mention of network-northd_hosts, which
is a required grouping for a successful OVN deployment. This patch
addresses that.

Change-Id: Ie532573cc04722d18915996c5148eecb180ee7ec
(cherry picked from commit 0d6ca7f07f42e7ff3c4a8ae401332b222017eb99)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/34/869834/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: In an OpenStack-Ansible deployment, infrastructure hosts are intended to run OVN northd-related services, while compute hosts are intended to run OVN controller-related services. In ``openstack_user_config.yml``, specify the hosts or aliases that will run the ``ovn-northd`` service(s), like so: .. code-block:: yaml network-northd_hosts: infra01: ip: 172.25.1.11 infra02: ip: 172.25.1.12 infra03: ip: 172.25.1.13 Alternatively, an alias can be specified, like so: .. code-block:: yaml network-northd_hosts: *infrastructure_hosts It is up to the deployer to dictate which nodes are considered "OVN Gateway Chassis" nodes by using the ``network-gateway_hosts`` inventory group in ``openstack_user_config.yml``.
deleted_lines: In an OpenStack-Ansible deployment, members of the ``network_hosts`` group are considered members of the ``neutron_ovn_northd`` group and run OVN northd-related services, while members of the ``compute_hosts`` group are considered members of the ``neutron_ovn_controller`` group and run OVN controller-related services. It is up to the deployer to dictate which nodes are considered "OVN Gateway Chassis" nodes by using the ``network-gateway_hosts`` inventory group in ``openstack_user_config.yml``.

commit_message:
Add user/project names to polled samples

Project and user names would be first fetched from cache, if not found,
they will be requested from keystone and then cached. Using cache will
significanlty reduce the number of calls made to keystone.

If ceilometer is configured with no caching backend, the results
will always be fetched by querying request to keystone.

A new config option, `tenant_name_discovery` is introduced
to operate this feature. This feature is optional and is disabled by default.

No attempts to identify names will be made if uuids are found to be `None`.

Signed-off-by: Yadnesh Kulkarni <ykulkarn@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iee5dbf09a1fd3ac571746fc66d2683eb8e6a1b27
(cherry picked from commit 79454d6b22787627ae6239aa7b2707101ba30212)

commit_message:
Make tox.ini tox 4.0 compatible

* use min version 4.2.5, for fixes [1][2][3]
* passenv fixed as space-separated list is not allowed anymore
* dock target uses requirements from requirements.txt as well as
  doc/requirements.txt
* skipsdist is not supported
* whitelist_externals has been removed in favour of allowlist_externals

* reno was added to doc/requirements.txt to fix the releasenotes target
* update setup.cfg to install aodh from tarball in the requirements
  The tarball wasn't being installed when specified in tox.ini, and the
  [extras] section in setup.cfg needed updating to support installing
  from a URL

[1] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/2754
[2] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/pull/2824
[3] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/pull/2828

Change-Id: I4122d0d05f297f864318e80392e6c77fb2e9fdcf

commit_message:
[Pure Storage] Support an array value for pure_iscsi_cidr_list

The pure_iscsi_cidr_list parameter is a ListOpt and accepts a comma-
separated list.

This allows using a native array value for the parameter so that users
can more easily compose the value in manifests.

Conflicts:
	spec/defines/cinder_backend_pure_spec.rb

Change-Id: I28dabef27ddccd0d343e4e96e16c943dfb6824ac
(cherry picked from commit 043edf748abb486612ddf9bee9d39221e756c479)
(cherry picked from commit 0cd364045f0d6b4afc5f6a27fb9dd4eb39b44506)

added_lines: def test_multi_create(self): self.start_compute( hostname='test_compute0', pci_info=fakelibvirt.HostPCIDevicesInfo(num_pci=3)) self.assertPCIDeviceCounts('test_compute0', total=3, free=3) test_compute0_placement_pci_view = { "inventories": { "0000:81:00.0": {self.PCI_RC: 1}, "0000:81:01.0": {self.PCI_RC: 1}, "0000:81:02.0": {self.PCI_RC: 1}, }, "traits": { "0000:81:00.0": [], "0000:81:01.0": [], "0000:81:02.0": [], }, "usages": { "0000:81:00.0": {self.PCI_RC: 0}, "0000:81:01.0": {self.PCI_RC: 0}, "0000:81:02.0": {self.PCI_RC: 0}, }, "allocations": {}, } self.assert_placement_pci_view( "test_compute0", **test_compute0_placement_pci_view) extra_spec = {'pci_passthrough:alias': f'{self.ALIAS_NAME}:1'} pci_flavor_id = self._create_flavor(extra_spec=extra_spec) body = self._build_server(flavor_id=pci_flavor_id, networks='none') body.update( { "min_count": "2", } ) self.api.post_server({'server': body}) servers = self.api.get_servers(detail=False) for server in servers: self._wait_for_state_change(server, 'ACTIVE') self.assertEqual(2, len(servers)) self.assertPCIDeviceCounts('test_compute0', total=3, free=1) # we have no way to influence which instance takes which device, so # we need to look at the nova DB to properly assert the placement # allocation devices = objects.PciDeviceList.get_by_compute_node( self.ctxt, objects.ComputeNode.get_by_nodename(self.ctxt, 'test_compute0').id, ) for dev in devices: if dev.instance_uuid: test_compute0_placement_pci_view["usages"][ dev.address][self.PCI_RC] = 1 test_compute0_placement_pci_view["allocations"][ dev.instance_uuid] = {dev.address: {self.PCI_RC: 1}} self.assert_placement_pci_view( "test_compute0", **test_compute0_placement_pci_view) self.assert_no_pci_healing("test_compute0")

added_lines: def _create_two_computes(self): return ( test_compute0_placement_pci_view, test_compute1_placement_pci_view, ) def _create_two_computes_and_an_instance_on_the_first(self): ( test_compute0_placement_pci_view, test_compute1_placement_pci_view, ) = self._create_two_computes() def test_reschedule(self): ( test_compute0_placement_pci_view, test_compute1_placement_pci_view, ) = self._create_two_computes() # try to boot a VM with a single device but inject fault on the first # compute so that the VM is re-scheduled to the other extra_spec = {'pci_passthrough:alias': f'{self.ALIAS_NAME}:1'} pci_flavor_id = self._create_flavor(extra_spec=extra_spec) calls = [] orig_guest_create = ( nova.virt.libvirt.driver.LibvirtDriver._create_guest) def fake_guest_create(*args, **kwargs): if not calls: calls.append(1) raise fakelibvirt.make_libvirtError( fakelibvirt.libvirtError, "internal error", error_code=fakelibvirt.VIR_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR, ) else: return orig_guest_create(*args, **kwargs) with mock.patch( 'nova.virt.libvirt.driver.LibvirtDriver._create_guest', new=fake_guest_create ): server = self._create_server( flavor_id=pci_flavor_id, networks='none') compute_pci_view_map = { 'test_compute0': test_compute0_placement_pci_view, 'test_compute1': test_compute1_placement_pci_view, } allocated_compute = server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host'] not_allocated_compute = ( "test_compute0" if allocated_compute == "test_compute1" else "test_compute1" ) allocated_pci_view = compute_pci_view_map.pop( server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host']) not_allocated_pci_view = list(compute_pci_view_map.values())[0] self.assertPCIDeviceCounts(allocated_compute, total=1, free=0) allocated_pci_view["usages"][ "0000:81:00.0"][self.PCI_RC] = 1 allocated_pci_view["allocations"][ server['id']] = {"0000:81:00.0": {self.PCI_RC: 1}} self.assert_placement_pci_view(allocated_compute, **allocated_pci_view) self.assertPCIDeviceCounts(not_allocated_compute, total=1, free=1) self.assert_placement_pci_view( not_allocated_compute, **not_allocated_pci_view)

commit_message:
[Pure Storage] Support an array value for pure_iscsi_cidr_list

The pure_iscsi_cidr_list parameter is a ListOpt and accepts a comma-
separated list.

This allows using a native array value for the parameter so that users
can more easily compose the value in manifests.

Change-Id: I54edf6db0fe52d513a60130c5260e5c110604233

commit_message:
Update branches: for tripleo-ci-centos-8-standalone

In [1] we removed the c8 jobs from running on stable/wallaby
(keeping only a subset ffu/mixed-rhel jobs).

However the standalone-upgrade-ffu job is parenting from
c8-standalone and the branches: match here is too restrictive
preventing the ffu-standalone from running in wallaby. This
re-adds wallaby into branches for that parent job.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/867351

Change-Id: I71734ea9711c9d14f51e26254ec9964aa22df060
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/69/869669/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: branches: stable/train

commit_message:
Remove trunk.registry from tripleo-ci repo

trunk.registry.rdoproject.org going to decomission
soon. This patch remove trunk.registry from
tripleo-ci repo.

This patch also removes Dockerfile_rhui.j2 template,
which is used internally. No need to keep it in the
upstream.

Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I11bc7cc37af6271fac7c651c8598a741cf0af783

Octavia OVN Provider: Fix missing hieradata for NB/SB DB ports

This change ensures OVN NB/DB ports are defined in hieradata where
octavia is enabled, even octavia is deployed in a separate node.

commit_message:
host puppet: Do not fail until debug output

Currently we have the debug task to dump output of the puppet run for
host configuration, but the task is not executed in case puppet fails.
This makes troubleshooting quite difficult because we don't have well-
formatted output in case of failures.

This ensures the debug task is executed, and ansible fails AFTER debug
output is shown.

Because we have the separate debug task, the output from the initial
puppet execution can be hidden.

Change-Id: I270eb553d4b2f001781d02d7639b7957cbbab99f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/27/865927/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: no_log: true failed_when: - not puppet_host_outputs.finished
deleted_lines: failed_when: - (not puppet_host_outputs.finished) or (puppet_host_outputs.rc is defined and puppet_host_outputs.rc not in [0, 2])

commit_message:
Add service options to only undercloud.conf

Service options such as enable_neutron are only used for undercloud and
are NEVER used for standalone deployment. This removes these options
from standalone.conf.

Closes-Bug: #1998456
Change-Id: I2058383eb39f26fbe71b20a21cd0ace0db212b97

commit_message:
undercloud: Remove deprecated enable_<service> options

This removes all deprecated enable_<service> options. These services
are no longer supported in Undercloud and the options have had no
effect since the Zed release.

Change-Id: Id7cdfb38254a176d7bf53c43f84a13841635f534

commit_message:
Use standard home directory for outputs

This change ensures the home directory is used to output files for
standalone deployment and config export.

Previously the output directory is affected by undercloud.conf but
this config file is for undercloud installation and is not meant to
affect the other commands.

This allows us to avoid loading config file when defining constants.

Change-Id: I04426219a975a2dcfc593faa08c2de8b7af661ae

commit_message:
Export memcache node names in addition to ips

Since [1] was merged, hostnames, instead of ips, are used to connect
memcache. Thus memcache_node_names should be exported in addition to
memcache_node_ips. Currently memcache_node_ips is still used by
Horizon[2], thus it is still kept in the exported data.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/796832
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/812349

Change-Id: I10c6a26ba3ca161d38cd98b1b8d33c31dc68372c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/11/861011/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove unused mocking by noop_resource

The noop_resource function is no longer used with Keystone_* resources,
thus the additional mocking for Keystone_* resources is no longer
needed.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/845330
Change-Id: I4f20aa7da4b259fb1a7557b83638d0463ebeecbb

commit_message:
Remove password migrations for placement and rpc services

These migrations should have been done when a deployment is upgraded
to stable/train. Thus we no longer need these in recent releases.

Change-Id: Ibdd7162916cb4f2a21a80ed9e846b784722f4415
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/73/846073/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: placement_extracted = True placement_extracted = True placement_extracted = False try: # We can't rely on the existence of PlacementPassword to # determine if placement extraction has occured as it was added # in stein while the service extraction was delayed to train. # Inspect the endpoint map instead. endpoint_res = heat.resources.get(container, 'EndpointMap') endpoints = endpoint_res.attributes.get('endpoint_map', None) placement_extracted = endpoints and 'PlacementPublic' in endpoints except heat_exc.HTTPNotFound: pass # NOTE(ansmith): if rabbit password previously generated and # stored, facilitate upgrade and use for oslo messaging in plan env if 'RabbitPassword' in passwords: for i in ('RpcPassword', 'NotifyPassword'): if i not in passwords: passwords[i] = passwords['RabbitPassword'] # NOTE(owalsh): placement previously used NovaPassword # Default to the same password for PlacementPassword if it is an # upgrade (i.e NovaPassword is set) so we do not need to update the # password in keystone if not placement_extracted and 'NovaPassword' in passwords: LOG.debug('Setting PlacementPassword to NovaPassword') passwords['PlacementPassword'] = passwords['NovaPassword']

commit_message:
Drop unused EnableArchitecture<arch>

This has never been used actually even by instack-undercloud and
the AdditionalArchitectures parameter is now used instead of this.

Change-Id: Ib476d89d716842340594222c611b3d2773f06f59
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/83/861283/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # In queens (instack-undercloud) we used this to setup additional # architectures. For rocky+ we want to pass a list and be smarter in # THT. We can remove this in 'T' when we get there. for arch in CONF['additional_architectures']: env_data['EnableArchitecture%s' % arch.upper()] = True

commit_message:
Revert "[EL9] Set NovaLibvirtNumPciePorts to 12"

This reverts the following two commits with the same commit title.
 eefc98e6d5afaea46fa866ee6900ef922551ea92 (overcloud-deploy role)
 2a7adb2cdcfc2687dc7a1700d5b1740ba5b0e30e (standalone role)

Two revert patches are squashed to this single one because these two
commits implement the exactly same workaround to different roles.

Reason for revert:
The issue with underlying CentOS has been fixed by [1].

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2006409

Conflicts:
	roles/overcloud-deploy/templates/config-download.yaml.j2
	roles/standalone/templates/standalone_config.yaml.j2

Related-Bug: #1947861
Change-Id: I9b5f55cbc1c62aeb884d9259f667d82271693257
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/99/861699/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # TODO: This is workaround for https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2006409, Remove this # once this bug is fixed. {% if release not in ['train', 'ussuri', 'victoria'] %} NovaLibvirtNumPciePorts: 12 {% endif %}

subject: Remove reference to unused hieradata keys
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-03-03 13:53:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/5df02822c4d69327178fe1911382a6d6d42b03c5', 'message': "Remove reference to unused hieradata keys

Currently some parameters use specific hierata keys to pick up values
but these hierata keys are not used by tht. This change removes such
unnecessary usage to reduce amount of hiera look up.

Note that the parameters updated by this change are all set by tht
parameters(or are hardcoded). Thus we don't expect any user would try
overriding these parameters using hieradata key, instead of puppet
parameters.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/831778

commit_message:
Remove reference to unused hieradata keys

Currently some parameters use specific hierata keys to pick up values
but these hierata keys are not used by tht. This change removes such
unnecessary usage to reduce amount of hiera look up.

Note that the parameters updated by this change are all set by tht
parameters(or are hardcoded). Thus we don't expect any user would try
overriding these parameters using hieradata key, instead of template
parameters.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/831778
Change-Id: I5b84c9a6015e9f1b097331d1c4a48d35e39eedfa

deleted_lines: # An array of snmp config.# The SNMP auth type # Defaults to hiera('snmpd_readonly_user_authtype') if set else 'MD5' # # [*snmpd_password*] # The SNMP password # Defaults to hiera('snmpd_readonly_user_password') # # [*snmpd_user*] # The SNMP username # Defaults to hiera('snmpd_readonly_user_name') $snmpd_auth_type = hiera('snmpd_readonly_user_authtype', 'MD5'), $snmpd_password = hiera('snmpd_readonly_user_password'), $snmpd_user = hiera('snmpd_readonly_user_name'),

commit_message:
Gnocchi: Ensure NFS mount is ready

This change adds additional systemd dependency so that Gnocchi services
are started after its backend NFS filesystem is ready. Otherwise
the services can start without access to NFS and use host filesystem
which results in unexpected behavior.

Because current TripleO supports customizing the mount point for NFS
backend, we use the global remote-fs.target instead of the speficic
*.mount .

Change-Id: I09470cd5802b4d652a495e15e08c4cf065a20f6a

Keyrings.

commit_message:
Remove redundant inclusion of the rsyslog class

The rsyslog class is included by the rsyslog::config class since v5.0.0
and explicit inclusion is no longer required.

Change-Id: I53ed5f884ad7dfcbc417804ed712790c4ac871f2

commit_message:
Fix missing puppet-collectd

The puppet-collectd module is requires by puppet-tripleo since support
for collectd serivce was added[1].

[1] 959101f7c9deeeef078e347bcc828889036e5f10

Change-Id: I6d6349a8d4df456c1df4b4ed702b68296e3bcb6f

commit_message:
Remove unused interfaces related to overcloudrc generation

_create_overcloudrc_from_outputs was earlier used by tripleoclient but
was replaced by the new, public create_overcloudrc.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/853917
Change-Id: I26fa76fe55a54a9bf47ccdb74869f7fe65187500

deleted_lines: def get_service_ips(stack): service_ips = {} for output in stack.to_dict().get('outputs', {}): service_ips[output['output_key']] = output['output_value'] return service_ips def get_endpoint_map(stack): endpoint_map = {} for output in stack.to_dict().get('outputs', {}): if output['output_key'] == 'EndpointMap': endpoint_map = output['output_value'] break return endpoint_map def get_endpoint(key, stack): endpoint_map = get_endpoint_map(stack) if endpoint_map: return endpoint_map[key]['host'] return get_service_ips(stack).get(key + 'Vip') def get_overcloud_endpoint(stack): for output in stack.to_dict().get('outputs', {}): if output['output_key'] == 'KeystoneURL': return output['output_value'] def _create_overcloudrc( stack, no_proxy, admin_password=None, region_name=None): """Given the stack and proxy settings, create the overcloudrc stack: Heat stack containing the deployed overcloud no_proxy: a comma-separated string of hosts that shouldn't be proxied """ endpoint = get_overcloud_endpoint(stack) admin_vip = get_endpoint('KeystoneAdmin', stack) return _create_overcloudrc_from_outputs( stack.stack_name, endpoint, admin_vip, no_proxy) stack_name, endpoint, admin_vip, no_proxy, admin_password=None, region_name=None):

Remove non-existing monitoring service directory

The monitoring service(Sensu client) was removed BEFORE train release
by [1] and does not exist in any open branches we maintain.

[1] b3ffd695fd73412a07ed21a7e1744469e4436535

Change-Id: Iad4ee244120c3f3e8a14518e7bdda9c672c06520

commit_message:
Handle dictionary instead of raw json string

This is follow-up of ad6bc22f217929a78ba2a9dada036b176d2717ed and
refactors handling of the json file content using native dictionary +
to_json function. This allows us to more easily maintain the content.

Change-Id: I393dace7aacd5df385e002dceee27165bdc758f3

commit_message:
unbound: Remove unused parameters

The following parameters are not used by the unbound service, thus can
be removed from the resource template.
 - OVNDnsServers
 - NeutronDhcpAgentDnsmasqDnsServers

Change-Id: I99c4fd22b8cfdbcea3fa660cebd50c599b85ba61

commit_message:
Nova: Squash NovaLibvirtCommon resource

The NovaLibvirtCommon resource is not shared but is used only by
the resource template for modular libvirt services.

This change squashed that redundant resource to the modular libvirt
service template, so that we can reduce number of resources and
templates we maintain.

Change-Id: I8c4fc827aa32f97ae79f52001a3e02c711c9ec83

commit_message:
Remove manifest to deploy OVNDB at host

This removes the manifest file to deploy the OVNDB service as
a pacemaker resource running at host. The OVNDB service should be
deployed in containers instead and we use a different manifest for it.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/852447
Change-Id: I8b03cbc00fc6e9174610124b031fc42fd671e384

See tripleo-heat-templates # for more details. # Defaults to hiera('step') # # [*pcs_tries*] # (Optional) The number of times pcs commands should be retried. # Defaults to hiera('pcs_tries', 20) # # [*ovn_dbs_vip*] # (Optional) The vip to be used for OVN DB servers. It is expected that # the vip resource to be created before calling this class. # Defaults to hiera('ovn_dbs_vip') # # [*nb_db_port*] # The TCP port in which the OVN Northbound DB listens to. # Defaults to 6641 # # [*sb_db_port*] # The TCP port in which the OVN Southbound DB listens to. # Defaults to 6642 # class tripleo::profile::pacemaker::ovn_northd ( $pacemaker_master = hiera('ovn_dbs_short_bootstrap_node_name'), $step = Integer(hiera('step')), $pcs_tries = hiera('pcs_tries', 20), $ovn_dbs_vip = hiera('ovn_dbs_vip'), $nb_db_port = 6641, $sb_db_port = 6642 ) { if $step >= 2 { pacemaker::property { 'ovndb-role-node-property': property => 'ovndb-role', value => true, tries => $pcs_tries, node => $::hostname, } } if $step >= 3 and downcase($::hostname) == $pacemaker_master { $ovndb_servers_resource_name = 'ovndb_servers' $ovndb_servers_ocf_name = 'ovn:ovndb-servers' $ovndb_vip_resource_name = "ip-${ovn_dbs_vip}" $ovn_dbs_vip_norm = normalize_ip_for_uri($ovn_dbs_vip) # By step 3, all the VIPs would have been created. # After creating ovn ocf resource, colocate it with the # VIP - commit_message:
Nova: refactor redundant logic to determine live_migration_inbound_addr

The live_migration_inbound_addr pameter is always set consistently
regardless of the use of tls for migration, thus can be defined in
the common place instead of duplicating the same value in if-else
block.

Change-Id: Ic3f52dec73dd78b9f18b069cf672b68faf99798c

commit_message:
Neutron: Fix description of comma_delimited_list parameters

The parameters defined with the comma_delimited_list type accept not
only comma-separated list strings ('a,b,c') but also native lists
(['a', 'b', 'c']).

This change drops the explicit mentons of "comma-separated list"
because it's not mandatory and users can use the native list format.

Change-Id: I1e10b740c95b16061f0e8ec33243da2bd5164895

commit_message:
Drop environments/services-baremetal

This directory was initially created[1] to store environment files to
enable baremetal services, but the actual files in the directory
enables containers.

Because current TripleO no longer supports baremetal services and
similar environment files exist in the different directories
(environments/service or environments), this removes the confusing
directory.

[1] 882fb2a89697b175d9e6043f1da37ecc3efd92c9

Change-Id: Ie17aa4117d379a34a25444b4a9a3702d4a1d5f70

commit_message:
Remove logic for frr 7.x

Now TripleO supports only CentOS 9 or RHEL 9, which ship frr 8.x. So
now we can remove the logic for that old version.

Also see change Ie0aef47ca0900ad4ad8222ea0c4454a83e4b7c59 for details.

Change-Id: If5afdb15ef7f1e19347d36e6f530d7b5de5cda14

commit_message:
Remove ineffective ServerDeletionPolicy

Now we use ephemeral stack instead of persisted stack, and create
a new stack when deleting a node from deployments.

Change-Id: I2fbe529df85703557756a69754b366d2f1db9b38

commit_message:
Validate CollectdConnectionType

The CollectdConnectionType parameter accepts only specific values
(amqp1 and network). This change makes the given value validated
during stack creation so that a wrong value can be detected early.

Change-Id: If700a6d9808e7465c870d675122acfef049a3dc7

commit_message:
NetApp volume driver: Use different shares config file per backend

... to avoid conflicts when multiple backends are used. Previously
users always need to set the CinderNetappNfsSharesConfig parameter to
avoid multiple backends from using the same share file. However this
requirement is redundant and causes the duplicate resource declaration
in puppet, which is usually unclear to users.

This also allows us to avoid conflict with NFS backend, which uses
the same config file (/etc/cinder/shares.conf) by default.

Change-Id: I8b4a179a1122191fae73db4da1c7ec72d55f5065

commit_message:
RabbitMQ: Remove support for Master/Slave RA

We have not been using/testing this feature for a while, and multi-
master cluster, which is the current default, is usually enough.

Change-Id: Ifb1f87492dae44effd031bf0350cf0ae86640fbc

added_lines: --- prelude: > Replace this text with content to appear at the top of the section for this release. All of the prelude content is merged together and then rendered separately from the items listed in other parts of the file, so the text needs to be worded so that both the prelude and the other items make sense when read independently. This may mean repeating some details. Not every release note requires a prelude. Usually only notes describing major features or adding release theme details should have a prelude. features: - | List new features here, or remove this section. All of the list items in this section are combined when the release notes are rendered, so the text needs to be worded so that it does not depend on any information only available in another section, such as the prelude. commit_message:
Swift: Deprecate deployment for dispersion tool

This feature prepares a few resources so that users can run
the swift-dispersion report easily, but it is not required by
the core functionality of swift.

The feature still requires that the swift package is installed in host
instead of containers.

Change-Id: I8d552ab2a44ed12e53187e22a54e74ef06c5a421

commit_message:
Enable ceilometermiddleware in scenario 002

Currently usage of ceilometermiddleware is not tested in any scenario
jobs. This enables the feature in scenario 002 because this scenario
is the only one with both swift and ceilometer are enabled.

commit_message:
Drop incomplete implementation to deploy netcontrold

Support for netcontrold was added by [1] but it has never been
completed. The change to build the container image for this service[2]
was abandoned without any alternative solution.

Because feature has never been implemented completely, this removes
the useless and unmaintained implementation.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/694765
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/695626

Change-Id: I642df369ca7240ca11c9e7a78ba79c8e12ec9df6

is used instead of OS_CLOUDNAME. This fixes the reference to the old
OS_CLOUDNAME environment.

Trivial-Fix

commit_message:
Remove unused arguments of _heat_deploy

The following arguments of the _heat_deploy method are not used.
 - run_validations
 - roles_file
 - deployment_options

This change removes these arguments and also a few unused arguments
from the other methods calling it.

Also, it seems the --run-validation option has had no effect. This
removes reference to that option and deprecate it officially, so that
we can remove it in a future release.

Change-Id: Ia31ef4ff785aa75ea6c7d7f2f4a8eaadfb397ba4

commit_message:
Remove redundant Tmpwatch service

The tmpwatch package is installed by the tripleo_boostrap role since
[1] was merged, and it's not required to ensure the package twice.

[1] 9d00098c6a217f2cf1dc2fda93a026ecb5ffec88

commit_message:
Use native plugin to manage security group resources

We already use the ansible plugin to manage security group rules for
log forwarding, so using it globally would make implementation simpler
than using both shell + the ansible plugin.

Also, the security groups are now created in the project consistent
with the security group rules.

Change-Id: I90b100728a1a516b0640ceb890fd3a234246a96a

shared_examples_for 'tripleo::profile::base::ironic::conductor' do context 'with step less than 3' do let(:params) { { :step => 1, :bootstrap_node => 'node.example.com', } } it { is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::ironic') is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::ironic::authtoken') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::conductor') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::interfaces') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::pxe') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::pxe') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::ansible') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::drac') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::ilo') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::ipmi') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::redfish') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::staging') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::cinder') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::inspector') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::glance') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::neutron') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::service_catalog') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::swift') } end context 'with step 3 on bootstrap node' do let(:params) { { :step => 3, :bootstrap_node => 'node.example.com', } } it { is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::ironic') is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::ironic::authtoken') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::conductor') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::interfaces') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::pxe') is_expected.to contain_class('ironic::pxe') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::ansible') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::drac') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::ilo') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::ipmi') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::redfish') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::staging') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::cinder') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::inspector') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::glance') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::neutron') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::service_catalog') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::swift') } end context 'with step 3 not on bootstrap node' do let(:params) { { :step => 3, :bootstrap_node => 'other.example.com', } } it { is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::ironic') is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::ironic::authtoken') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::conductor') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::interfaces') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::pxe') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::pxe') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::ansible') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::drac') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::ilo') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::ipmi') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::redfish') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::staging') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::cinder') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::inspector') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::glance') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::neutron') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::service_catalog') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::swift') } end context 'with step 4' do let(:params) { { :step => 4, :bootstrap_node => 'other.example.com', } } it { is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::ironic') is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::ironic::authtoken') is_expected.to contain_class('ironic::conductor') is_expected.to contain_class('ironic::driver::interfaces') is_expected.to contain_class('ironic::driver::pxe') is_expected.to contain_class('ironic::pxe') is_expected.to contain_class('ironic::driver::ansible') is_expected.to contain_class('ironic::driver::drac') is_expected.to contain_class('ironic::driver::ilo') is_expected.to contain_class('ironic::driver::ipmi') is_expected.to contain_class('ironic::driver::redfish') is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::driver::staging') is_expected.to contain_class('ironic::cinder') is_expected.to contain_class('ironic::driver::inspector') is_expected.to contain_class('ironic::glance') is_expected.to contain_class('ironic::neutron') is_expected.to contain_class('ironic::service_catalog') is_expected.to contain_class('ironic::swift') } end context 'with step 4 and pxe/ipxe environment managemeng disabled' do let(:params) { { :step => 4, :bootstrap_node => 'other.example.com', } } it { is_expected.to_not contain_class('ironic::pxe') } end context 'with step 4 and staging driver enabled' do let(:params) { { :step => 4, :bootstrap_node => 'other.example.com', } } it { is_expected.to contain_class('ironic::driver::staging') } end end on_supported_os.each do |os, facts| context "on #{os}" do let(:facts) do facts.merge(OSDefaults.get_facts({ :hostname => 'node.example.com' })) end it_behaves_like 'tripleo::profile::base::ironic::conductor' end end end

commit_message:
ironic: Remove authtoken configurations from conductor manifest

... because ironic-conductor does not depend on authtoken middleware.

Change-Id: I6cae6bf2ac62768b38efb0d5326033e1ead95644

commit_message:
Enable debug in standalone heat

We already enabled debug in ephemeral heat for debugging purpose.

This enables debug for standalone heat so that we can more deeply
debug problems with standalone/undercloud installation.

Change-Id: I3684b68b35734ba46683e530b4c6c01d18b8a951
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/20/850220/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: debug = true

commit_message:
container_puppet_config: Merge volumes correctly

This change fixes the wrong handling of "volumes" key in puppet_config,
to avoid failure if there are multiple puppet_config definitions with
the same config_volume but different sets of volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1980905
Change-Id: I0e1fd858f3548b72d07a067db9e221eae3c77823
(cherry picked from commit 5aed143349c351de067fa9f314f2a292ef523131)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/25/849525/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: volumes_orig = ( returned_dict[config_volume].get('volumes', []) ) volumes_orig.extend(volumes) sorted(set(volumes_orig))
deleted_lines: volumes_orig = returned_dict[config_volume].get('volumes', []) if volumes_orig: volumes = volumes_orig.extend(volumes) sorted(set(volumes))

commit_message:
Fix ignored RsyslogExtraLoggingSource

The RsyslogExtraLoggingSource parameter, which was added by [1], has
had no effect because of the missing top-level service name under
the service_config_settings key.

Also the parameter is used by the rsyslog service so it's not really
required to use the service_config_settings, which is used to pass
puppet parameters to a different service.

[1] a1b967fafefb1df39e9e04fae0476b14063dfff4

Change-Id: Icfee4a052fdea1851d2d97e4ae9a8324561abab3

deleted_lines: service_config_settings: tripleo_logging_sources_rsyslog: {get_attr: [RoleParametersValue, value, extra_logging_sources]}

This change ensures the backend classes are tested with the api class
included. This solves the following error we see after the change
4b4d7d9a5a9a1654dd9b59891f934cfac75501a0 was merged to puppet-glance.

commit_message:
Glance: Test backend classes with api class

The tripleo::profile::base::glance::backend::* are designed to be used
together with the tripleo::profile::base::glance::api class.
This change ensures the backend classes are tested with the api class
included. This solves the following error we see after the change
4b4d7d9a5a9a1654dd9b59891f934cfac75501a0 was merged to puppet-glance.

Could not find resource 'Service[glance-api]' for relationship from
'Anchor[swift::service::end]'

Change-Id: Ie8c7a7c7b092f501bfc7f4fd3d45b5a6118fcf50
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/44/826544/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: let(:pre_condition) do <<-eos class { 'tripleo::profile::base::glance::api': step => #{params[:step]} } eos end

commit_message:
Get rid of RemovalPoliciesMode

Since we switched to ephemeral heat, overcloud stack is always created
from scratch, so we no longer append RemovalPolicies but always update
it.

Change-Id: Iafa96c3abb106e1a91fdb5981894e65b0c503758
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/99/848699/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | The ``{{role.name}}RemovalPolicies`` parameter and the ``{{role.name}}RemovalPoliciesMode`` parameter have been removed. These are no longer used since undercloud heat was replaced by ephemeral heat.

commit_message:
Fix tox.ini for tox4

Use allowlist_externals instead of whitelist_externals.
Execute shell script with bash.

Change-Id: I42c50ac2a8c6e4145279820538e47189de8cb5f4

deleted_lines: whitelist_externals =whitelist_externals =

commit_message:
Correct syntax on toggleWipState

We must include keyword group before the group name.

Change-Id: Ibe9400980c926dae2b80283415af3a87c442b25b

revisions:

routers (like ipsec from vpnaas) to do not rely on python process

commit_message:
Set ip_nonlocal_bind to 1 for HA routers and DVR snat

Set nonlocal_bind to 1 to allow starting applications in both
routers (like ipsec from vpnaas). nonlocal_bin 0 prevens us from
starting ipsec in both routers simulteniously as process can't bind
to non existing address which was worarkunded in [1]
by setting dependency on python process during failover.

This revert [2] completely, which was partially reverted by [3].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/+/823904
[2] https://review.opendev.org/393886
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/752360

Related-Bug: 1999761

Change-Id: I18a15aa3ca745b2b794610350f538d02575ccbe0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/69/867769/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set nonlocal_bind to 1 to allow setup applications in HA mode # for example ipsec from VPNaaS ip_lib.set_ip_nonlocal_bind_for_namespace(self.name, 1)
deleted_lines: # This might be an HA router namespaces and it should not have # ip_nonlocal_bind enabled ip_lib.set_ip_nonlocal_bind_for_namespace(self.name, 0)

commit_message:
Remove redundant editHashtag lines

This change should not change any effective permisssions; it's being
pushed in order to create some file churn so earlier ironic-inspector
changes will apply. As a benefit, it also removes redundant things from
config.

Change-Id: I67a5de270a74ae88a4596c41e73dc59955e83439
